requirement_tested: A question submission form with fields for question title and content
user_persona: A curious user named Alex who has a question about cooking techniques.
user_goal: To submit a new question about how to properly sear a steak.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Question Form
narrative_steps.description: Alex is browsing the homepage and decides to ask a question. He clicks the floating '+' button at the bottom right of the screen.
narrative_steps.action: Click the floating '+' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal form titled 'Ask a Question' appears with fields for 'Title' and 'Content'.

narrative_steps.title: Filling in Details
narrative_steps.description: Alex types 'How do I properly sear a steak?' into the Title field and adds more context in the Content field.
narrative_steps.action: Enter text into the 'Title' and 'Content' fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both input fields accept text input and display the typed content.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting the Question
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with his wording, Alex presses Enter in the content field to submit the form quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Press Enter key in the content field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form submits successfully, closes the modal, and shows a success confirmation message.

requirement_tested: A page displaying a list of submitted questions with titles and excerpts
user_persona: Jamie, a frequent visitor looking for solutions to common tech issues.
user_goal: To find an existing question about fixing slow computer performance.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Question List
narrative_steps.description: Jamie lands on the main questions page and sees a list of recently asked questions displayed as cards.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the main questions page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A vertical list of question cards is displayed, each showing a bold title and a content excerpt.

narrative_steps.title: Scanning Through Questions
narrative_steps.description: Jamie scrolls down the list and notices several relevant topics but none exactly matching his issue yet.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the question list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: More questions load dynamically as Jamie reaches the bottom of the scrollable area.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Relevant Question
narrative_steps.description: Seeing a promising title, 'Why is my laptop running slowly?', Jamie clicks on the card to read more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a question card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The user is navigated to the detailed view page for that specific question.

requirement_tested: A detailed question view showing full question content and associated answers
user_persona: Taylor, a student researching historical events for a paper.
user_goal: To understand various perspectives on the causes of World War I by reading answers to a related question.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Detailed View
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks on a question titled 'What were the primary causes of WWI?' from the question list.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a question from the list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The detailed question view loads, displaying the full title and content of the question.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Existing Answers
narrative_steps.description: Below the question, Taylor finds multiple expert-provided answers and begins reading them carefully.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll through the list of answers.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All answers associated with the question are displayed below the main content section.

narrative_steps.title: Voting on Useful Answers
narrative_steps.description: One answer particularly resonates with Taylorâ€™s research. She clicks the upvote button to show appreciation.
narrative_steps.action: Click the upvote icon next to an answer.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The vote count increases instantly without refreshing the page.

requirement_tested: An answer submission form accessible from each question's detail page
user_persona: Riley, a history teacher contributing knowledge to the community.
user_goal: To provide a comprehensive explanation of the Treaty of Versailles as an answer.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Answer Section
narrative_steps.description: On a question about post-WWI Europe, Riley scrolls to the bottom where he sees the 'Your Answer' form.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the answer submission form on the question detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A textarea labeled 'Your Answer' and a 'Post Your Answer' button appear beneath the existing answers.

narrative_steps.title: Writing an Answer
narrative_steps.description: Riley writes a detailed explanation covering economic, political, and social impacts of the treaty.
narrative_steps.action: Type a long-form answer into the textarea.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The textarea expands to accommodate the length of the written content.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting the Answer
narrative_steps.description: After proofreading, Riley clicks the 'Post Your Answer' button to share his insights.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Post Your Answer' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The answer is submitted via API and immediately appended to the list of answers without a page reload.

requirement_tested: A rating system allowing users to upvote or downvote answers
user_persona: Jordan, a critical reader evaluating answer quality.
user_goal: To express agreement or disagreement with answers based on accuracy and clarity.

narrative_steps.title: Upvoting Accurate Information
narrative_steps.description: Jordan reads a well-researched answer and decides to support it by clicking the up arrow.
narrative_steps.action: Click the upward arrow icon next to an accurate answer.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An API call records the upvote, and the vote count updates instantly in real time.

narrative_steps.title: Downvoting Misleading Content
narrative_steps.description: Another answer contains outdated information. Jordan clicks the down arrow to signal low quality.
narrative_steps.action: Click the downward arrow icon next to a misleading answer.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The downvote is recorded, and the vote count decreases immediately without a page refresh.

requirement_tested: Display of vote counts next to each answer
user_persona: Casey, a researcher prioritizing highly-rated responses.
user_goal: To identify the most helpful answers by sorting based on vote scores.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Top-Rated Answers
narrative_steps.description: Casey visits a complex question and looks for answers with the highest numerical ratings.
narrative_steps.action: Scan the vote counts displayed beside each answer.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each answer shows a numeric score representing net upvotes, helping Casey judge relevance.

requirement_tested: Persistent storage of questions and answers in a PostgreSQL database
user_goal: To verify that all user-generated content persists correctly after server restarts.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Data Persistence
narrative_steps.description: After restarting the backend service, DevOps checks if previously posted questions remain available.
narrative_steps.action: Restart the backend server and reload the question list page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All previously submitted questions and answers are still present and accessible.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for creating, retrieving, and listing questions and answers
user_persona: Frontend developer integrating with backend services.
user_goal: To confirm that all CRUD operations function correctly through RESTful APIs.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Create Endpoints
narrative_steps.description: Developer sends a POST request to /api/questions to simulate a new question creation.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to /api/questions endpoint with valid payload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with 201 Created and returns the newly created question object.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Retrieve Endpoints
narrative_steps.description: Developer requests a specific question by ID to validate GET functionality.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/questions/{id}.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server returns the correct question data including its associated answers.

requirement_tested: API endpoint for submitting votes on answers
user_goal: To ensure that votes are accurately tracked and updated in the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Sending Vote Requests
narrative_steps.description: Tester simulates an upvote action by sending a POST request to the vote endpoint.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to /api/answers/{id}/vote with body {"type": "up"}.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server processes the vote and returns the updated vote count in the response.

requirement_tested: Frontend components styled with beige background and saddle brown accents
user_goal: To ensure all interface elements match the specified color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Visual Design
narrative_steps.description: Designer inspects the homepage visually and through browser tools to verify colors.
narrative_steps.action: Open the homepage and inspect CSS styles applied to major components.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Main background is set to beige (#F5F5DC) and interactive elements/borders use saddle brown (#8B4513).

requirement_tested: Responsive layout suitable for desktop and mobile browsing
user_persona: Mobile user accessing the site during commute.
user_goal: To navigate and interact with the Q&A platform smoothly on a smartphone.

narrative_steps.title: Using Site on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: While commuting, Sam opens the Q&A site on his phone to browse some questions.
narrative_steps.action: Resize viewport to mobile dimensions or access site via mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts appropriately with stacked cards, collapsible menu, and readable font sizes.

requirement_tested: Navigation between question list and individual question details
user_goal: To move freely between overview and detailed views without confusion.

narrative_steps.title: Returning to Question List
narrative_steps.description: After reading one question thoroughly, Morgan wants to go back to the main list.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Home' link in the top navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User is redirected to the question list page with no loss of session or preferences.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Back Using Breadcrumbs
narrative_steps.description: From another question detail page, Morgan uses the breadcrumb trail to return to the previous level.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Questions' breadcrumb link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Breadcrumb navigation leads back to the appropriate parent page reliably.

requirement_tested: Real-time update of answer ratings without page refresh
user_persona: Active community member engaging with many answers.
user_goal: To rate multiple answers quickly without waiting for page loads.

narrative_steps.title: Rapid Voting Experience
narrative_steps.description: Ella rapidly clicks upvote buttons on several answers within a single question thread.
narrative_steps.action: Click multiple vote buttons in quick succession.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Vote counts update immediately in real time, providing instant feedback without delays.

requirement_tested: User interface for submitting new questions from any page
user_goal: To quickly pose a question regardless of which part of the site they're currently viewing.

narrative_steps.title: Quick Question Submission
narrative_steps.description: While reading an answer, Kai remembers something important and wants to ask a follow-up question.
narrative_steps.action: Click the floating '+' button visible on every page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Question submission form appears as a modal overlay without changing the current page.

requirement_tested: Backend service connecting to PostgreSQL using specified environment variables
user_goal: To deploy the backend securely with proper database configuration.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Environment Variables
narrative_steps.description: Admin sets the required DB environment variables before launching the backend service.
narrative_steps.action: Set DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Application starts successfully and establishes a secure connection to the PostgreSQL instance.
